item.title: Free PlayStation Plus Games For April 2025 Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/free-playstation-plus-games-for-april-2025-announced/

Sony has announced the three games available for free for all PlayStation Plus (PS Plus) subscribers for April 2025 will be RoboCop: Rogue City, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre, Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth – Hacker’s Memory.

All three games will be available for every active PS Plus member, no matter the tier, starting April 1. Just like past free games, once you add them to your library, they will be available to download at any time if you have an active subscription.

The new games will be available through May 5.

April 2025’s Free PlayStation Plus Games

Of the three games available in April, RoboCop: Rogue City is the most notable. Recently, a standalone sequel for the game called RoboCop: Rogue City – Unfinished Business was announced for a summer 2025 release.

The Texas Chainsaw Massacre was released 2023 and is based on the 1974 film where you play as either a victim or a member of the Slaughter family. Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth – Hacker’s Memory puts you in the role of Keisuke Amazawa who has been accused of a crime he didn’t commit.

If you haven’t yet, there’s still time to pick up March’s free games. Until March 31, subscribers can get Dragon Age: The Veilguard, Sonic Colors: Ultimate, and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Cowabunga Collection.

In addition to the new games for PlayStation Plus subscribers, those who are on Extra and Premium memberships received eight new games to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog in March. Those games include UFC 5 and Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown, among others.

What do you think of the free PlayStation Plus games for April 2025? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Forums.

item.title: OpTic Texas Repeats History, Drops Pred for Huke Again
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/optic-texas-repeats-history-drops-pred-for-huke-again/

OpTic Gaming announced a major change to their OpTic Texas Call of Duty roster today, but it’s one fans have seen before. For the second time in just a matter of months, OpTic Texas has removed Amer “Pred” Zulbeari in favor of Cuyler “Huke” Garland.

Huke In, Pred Out of OpTic Texas to Kick Off Another Call of Duty Rostermania Period

OpTic officially said thank you (and goodbye) to Pred today, thanking him for his “passion and energy.” Back in December, just months after OpTic Texas claimed the CDL championship, Pred moved to the inactive roster, needing a break to “handle personal issues” and fix his mental health. Days later though, he confirmed that he was a free agent, though still under contract with OpTic.

A World Champion with passion and energy for the game that is truly special ⚡ Always a part of our legacy. Thank you @Pred

In his place, Huke returned to the OpTic lineup after being away for more than a year. Following his CDL Championship with Dallas Empire in 2020, Huke had bounced around different spots, picking up stints with LA Thieves, LA Guerillas, the Seattle/Vancouver Surge. OpTic struggled early this season with Huke in the lineup, but even after Pred returned to the starting squad this past February, the results got even worse.

Before the Stage Two Major last weekend, OpTic Texas brought in Cesar “Skyz” Bueno, after a struggling Kenneth “Kenny” Williams chose to step down. Now after a second major change, the OpTic Texas roster will look ahead to the Stage 3 Major Qualifiers at the start of April. However, don’t expect OpTic Texas to be the only teams to make roster moves before the next CDL stage begins.

Is this the right call for OpTic Texas? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

item.title: Black Ops 6 Season 3 is Now Launching 24 Hours Early With Free Trial
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/black-ops-6-season-3-is-now-launching-24-hours-early-with-free-trial/

Black Ops 6 fans can jump into Season 3 content 24 hours early, it’s been announced. A free trial is also being offered, but Warzone fans are likely to be disappointed with the news.

Call of Duty’s Season 3 content was delayed a while back. Activision needed more time to perfect the nuances of the content. There’s also a suspicion that Verdansk needed extra time and care.

But it seems the Black Ops 6 development team is looking for an early start. BLOPS 6 Season 3 launches a day earlier than planned on April 2—but it comes with a minor caveat.

Warzone Season 3 & Verdansk Still Launches on April 3

There’s no doubting the star attraction of Black Ops 6 and Warzone Season 3, and that’s the return of Verdansk. However, players eager to jump back into the classic battle royale map have to wait for the previously announced delayed date.

“Season 03 of #BlackOps6 will be dropping early on April 2nd with a 24 hour free trial,” posted the official Call of Duty X page. This is great news for Black Ops 6 fans and potential newcomers eager to try the FPS out.

Unfortunately, if you want Verdansk a day early, you’re out of luck. The message also went on to say: “During that time Call of Duty: Warzone will go offline in preparation for the launch of Verdansk on April 3. Anyone who opens the Call of Duty: Warzone game menu during that time will receive the Kilo 141 for free.”

item.title: Fortnite Leaker Confirms Mortal Kombat Content is Finally Koming to Fortnite
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/fortnite-leaker-confirms-mortal-kombat-content-is-finally-koming-to-fortnite/

We’ve heard about Mortal Kombat content heading to Fortnite already. However, a new leak has pulled back the bloody curtain to reveal that March 28 potentially brings emotes, pickaxes, and skins to finish us (or anyone).

There was a time when I used to be shocked by Fortnite’s collaborations. It went out the window quickly once the likes of Kratos and Halo started dropping into Tilted Towers. Now, anyone who’s anyone can make an appearance—check out the Sabrina Carpenter dialog if you don’t believe me.

But there’s something surreal about the brutal nature of Mortal Kombat entering a new realm. Alas, after initial talk of Mortal Kombat content turning up for a fight in Fortnite, it’s reportedly the case.

Fortnite & Mortal Kombat Crossover Content Reportedly Releases March 28

Renowned leaker SpushFNBR has dropped a finishing blow on the MK and Fortnite conversation. They posted to their official X channel about the nature of the content coming to the battle royale shooter.

They provided a bullet-point list outlining some of the key inclusions:

  • Scorpion (MK3) Skin: 1.500 vbucks
  • Kitana (MK3) Skin: 1500 vbucks
  • Raiden (MK3) Skin: 1500 vbucks
  • Scorpion’s Flame Skull backbling: 800 bucks
  • Raiden’s Amulet backbling: 400 vbucks#
  • Raiden’s Staff pickaxe: 800 bucks
  • Scorpion’s Katana Duo pickaxe: included with the backbling
  • Kitana’s Steel Fan pickaxe: 800 bucks
  • Kitana’s Fan Bear: included with the pickaxe
  • Kitana’s Fan Fado emote: 300 bucks
  • FLAWLESS VICTORY emote: 300 bucks
  • Toasty! emote: 300 bucks
  • Test your strength emote: 300 bucks
  • Guiding Staff Mark emote: 300 bucks
  • Raiden’s Victory emote: 300 bucks

They finish by saying to expect the items on March 28. You can check out the full message here.

FORTNITE X CLASSIC KOMBAT (LOT OF COSMETICS!) Scorpion (MK3) Skin: 1.500 vbucks Kitana (MK3) Skin: 1500 vbucks Raiden (MK3) Skin: 1500 vbucks Scorpion’s Flame Skull backbling: 800 vbucks Raiden’s Amulet backbling: 400 vbucks Raiden’s Staff pickaxe: 800 vbucks Scorpion’s

This may be the beginning of a fun and fatal partnership. Take the leaks with the usual punch of salt, but there’s every chance you can start preparing your best kombos to drop onto unsuspecting Fortnite players.

The Mortal Kombat collab isn’t the only rumored to be in the works: Dragon Ball Daima and Kendrick Lamar might be boarding the bus soon enough.
